name: black body
description: an idealized physical body that absorbs all incident electromagnetic radiation, regardless of frequency or angle of incidence

name: conduction
description: a transfer of heat by microscopic collisions of particles and movement of electrons within a body

name: convection
description: a heat transfer due to bulk movement of molecules within fluids such as gases and liquids. Convection takes place through advection, diffusion or both

name: cooling load
description: a rate at which sensible and latent heat must be removed from the space to maintain a constant space dry-bulb air temperature and humidity

name: edge
description: one of the two basic units out of which graphs are constructed. Each edge has two (or in hypergraphs, more) vertices to which it is attached, called its endpoints. Edges may be directed or undirected

name: graph
description: a mathematical structure used to model pairwise relations between objects. A graph in this context is made up of vertices, nodes, or points which are connected by edges, arcs, or lines

name: heating load
description: a rate at which sensible and latent heat must be added to the space to maintain a constant space dry-bulb air temperature and humidity

name: latent heat
description: thermal energy released or absorbed by a body

name: MTIpython
description: a Python package, used within IHC, to solve engineering problems in the disciplines: fluids, thermodynamics, mechanical and electrical

name: node
description: fundamental unit of which graphs are formed

name: Python
description: an interpreted high-level programming language for general-purpose programming

name: radiation
description: an electromagnetic radiation generated by the thermal motion of charged particles in matter. All matter with a temperature greater than absolute zero emits thermal radiation

name: refrigerant
description: a substance or mixture, used in heat pumps to transport heat energy

name: Sankey diagram
description: a specific type of flow diagram, in which the width of the arrows is shown proportionally to the flow quantity

name: solvent
description: a substance that dissolves a solute, such as a chemically distinct liquid, solid or gas, resulting in a solution

name: tooltip
description: a popup window, containing additional information. It appears when a mouse pointer hoovers over a designated area
